comments:
I have installed 3.1 (build I20050627-1435) + all the plugins to get VE up and 
runnning. I think this maybe more of a core functionality bug, but was unsure 
which category to raise it under.

Reproduce as follows:

1. Start eclipse with -clean option in a new workspace
2. Create New Java Project
3. Right Click on Project->Build Path->Add Libraries 
4. Select SWT from dialog->Next

Get 'Error Caused by Operation 'Add Libraries to Java Build Path' dialog

You also get this if you use the Properties window to change the build path, 
but interstingly here, once you ahve added the library, but before pressing 
Next, if you expand the SWT icon you don't see anything other than the 'Access 
Rules'.

Know what version of VE you were running and if it is still happening?

Our latest VE driver is I20050715 and it runs on Eclipse 3.1 SDK final, GEF 3.1
Final, and EMF 2.1 Final.

Looks like you are on a standard win32 system with java 1.4.2, so all should be
well with that.

Thanks for the update. I think I might be on some older levels than the ones 
detailed below. I will check and update.

The jFace runable seemed to crash because the SWT container added a null entry.  

There seems to be only one place where this could have happened; in the
initCustom() path (Custome SWT path that uses an invalid direcotry/jar path).

I used this defect to fix it... but, I could not recreate this exception using a
bad path.

Please reOpen, if this fix did not resolve your scenario.
VE 1.1 is released. Moving to closed.
